meanings.sent1: The ship was anchored in the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The tent was anchored with heavy ropes to prevent it from blowing away.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel anchored its acorn stash under the old oak tree.
meanings.sent4: Her love for music anchored her through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The memories of her childhood home anchored her sense of belonging.

meanings.sent1: The anchored boat gently rocked in the calm waters.
meanings.sent2: The anchored beliefs of the community were deeply ingrained.
meanings.sent3: The anchored schedule kept everything running smoothly.
meanings.sent4: His anchored position in the company gave him a sense of security.

meanings.definition: To provide a stable foundation or support.
meanings.sent1: The strong roots of the tree anchored it firmly in the ground.
meanings.sent2: The friendship anchored her during challenging times.
meanings.sent3: The idea of teamwork anchored the success of the project.
meanings.sent4: His values anchored his decisions in life.
meanings.sent5: The community support anchored the new business in the neighborhood.
